Posted By: drpvfx (1/27/2012 6:48:59 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
He's great and all, but DAMN, 3 Forests! I started to type up my thoughts on the card when I reread it and noticed he gets a +1/+1 simply for attacking. So turn 4, when he's ready to go, he's already a 2/2. That's not bad. Though, you'd have to force the opponent to block it somehow, with a 2/2 creature. I suppose Lure will help now, but not if you're in Standard.   
  
The trick with him is getting him to even kill anything, but since simply attacking is all it takes to make him grow, eventually they're gonna be throwing it chumps to stop the 5/5 from getting through. Now they have to deal with the 6/6, and then the 7/7...oh my.
posts.html:

The trick with him is getting him to even kill anything, but since simply attacking is all it takes to make him grow, eventually they're gonna be throwing it chumps to stop the 5/5 from getting through. Now they have to deal with the 6/6, and then the 7/7...oh my.

Posted By: JunkerHQ (9/22/2012 3:46:46 PM)

posts.post_content: It is possible to get this out on turn one - I have done this once, and it was a long shot, but it CAN be done. [Forest](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Forest) + 2X [Chancellor of the Tangle](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Chancellor of the Tangle). Reveal them from your hand if you're lucky enough to get two in your opening hand, bang, three mana. Then you have an indestructible mower the entire game. I run this card with [Lure](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lure) too. I realize there are many ways to counter this creature, but none of my friends do so easily.
posts.html:
It is possible to get this out on turn one - I have done this once, and it was a long shot, but it CAN be done. Forest + 2X Chancellor of the Tangle. Reveal them from your hand if you're lucky enough to get two in your opening hand, bang, three mana. Then you have an indestructible mower the entire game. I run this card with Lure too.
